cycle_test_value.sql:
DELETE test_value FROM test_value
               INNER JOIN test_run ON test_run.id = test_value.test_run_id
               WHERE test_run.date_run < ?

cycle_test_aux_data.sql:
DELETE test_aux_data FROM test_aux_data
               INNER JOIN test_run ON test_run.id = test_aux_data.test_run_id
               WHERE test_run.date_run < ?

cycle_test_option_values.sql:
DELETE test_option_values FROM test_option_values
               INNER JOIN test_run ON test_run.id = test_option_values.test_run_id
               WHERE test_run.date_run < ?

cycle_test_data_all_dimentions.sql:
DELETE test_data_all_dimensions FROM test_data_all_dimensions
               INNER JOIN test_run ON test_run.id = test_data_all_dimensions.test_run_id
               WHERE test_run.date_run < ?

set_push_data_all_dimension.sql:
UPDATE test_data_all_dimensions
                SET pushlog_id = ?, push_date = ?
                WHERE revision = ? AND branch = ?

set_test_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `test` (`name`, `version`)
                SELECT ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `name`, `version`
                    FROM `test`
                    WHERE `name` = ? AND `version` = ?
                )

set_os_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `operating_system` ( `name`, `version` )
                SELECT ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `name`, `version`
                    FROM `operating_system`
                    WHERE `name` = ? AND `version` = ?
                )

set_aux_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `aux_data` (`test_id`, `name`)
                SELECT ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `test_id`, `name`
                    FROM `aux_data`
                    WHERE `test_id` = ? AND `name` = ?
                )

set_product_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `product` (`product`, `branch`, `version`)
                SELECT ?, ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `product`, `branch`, `version`
                    FROM `product`
                    WHERE `product` = ? AND `branch` = ? AND `version` = ?
                )

set_machine_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `machine` (`name`, `operating_system_id`, `date_added`)
                SELECT ?, ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `name`, `operating_system_id`
                    FROM `machine`
                    WHERE `name` = ? AND `operating_system_id` = ?
                )

set_option_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `option` (`name`)
                SELECT ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `name`
                    FROM `option`
                    WHERE `name` = ?
                )

set_pages_ref_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `pages` (`test_id`, `url`)
                SELECT ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `test_id`, `url`
                    FROM `pages`
                    WHERE `test_id` = ? AND `url` = ?
                )

set_build_data.sql:
INSERT INTO `build` (`product_id`,
                                     `test_build_id`,
                                     `processor`,
                                     `revision`,
                                     `build_type`,
                                     `build_date`)
                SELECT ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?
                FROM DUAL
                WHERE NOT EXISTS (
                    SELECT `product_id`,
                           `test_build_id`,
                           `processor`,
                           `build_type`
                    FROM `build`
                    WHERE `product_id` = ? AND
                          `test_build_id` = ? AND
                          `processor` = ? AND
                          `build_type` = ?
                )

set_summary_cache.sql:
INSERT INTO `summary_cache` (`item_id`, `item_data`, `value`, `date`)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)
                ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE `value` = ?, `date` = ?

set_metric_threshold.sql:
INSERT INTO `metric_threshold` (`product_id`,
                                                `operating_system_id`,
                                                `processor`,
                                                `build_type`,
                                                `metric_id`,
                                                `test_id`,
                                                `page_id`,
                                                `test_run_id`,
                                                `revision`)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
                ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE `product_id` = ?,
                                        `operating_system_id` = ?,
                                        `processor` = ?,
                                        `build_type` = ?,
                                        `metric_id` = ?,
                                        `test_id` = ?,
                                        `page_id` = ?,
                                        `test_run_id` = ?,
                                        `revision` = ?

set_gecko_revision.sql:
UPDATE test_run
               SET gecko_revision = ?
               WHERE id = ?

set_build_revision.sql:
UPDATE test_run
               SET build_revision = ?
               WHERE id = ?

set_machine_type.sql:
UPDATE machine
               SET type = ?
               WHERE id = ?

get_test_run_ids_not_in_all_dimensions.sql:
SELECT tr.id
               FROM test_run AS tr
               WHERE tr.id NOT IN (
                  SELECT tdad.test_run_id
                  FROM test_data_all_dimensions AS tdad
                  WHERE tdad.date_received >= ? )
               AND tr.date_run >= ?

get_test_data_all_dimensions.sql:
SELECT `test_run_id` AS 'ti',
                    `date_received` AS 'dr',
                    `revision` AS 'r',
                    `product` AS 'p',
                    `branch` AS 'b',
                    `branch_version` AS 'bv',
                    `operating_system_name` AS 'osn',
                    `operating_system_version` AS 'osv',
                    `processor` AS 'pr',
                    `build_type` AS 'bt',
                    `machine_name` AS 'mn',
                    `pushlog_id` AS 'pi',
                    `push_date` AS 'pd',
                    `test_name` AS 'tn',
                    `page_url` AS 'pu',
                    `mean` AS 'm',
                    `std` AS 's',
                    `h0_rejected` AS 'hr',
                    `p` AS 'pv',
                    `n_replicates` AS 'nr',
                    `fdr` AS 'f',
                    `trend_mean` AS 'tm',
                    `trend_std` AS 'ts',
                    `test_evaluation` AS 'te'
                FROM `test_data_all_dimensions`
                WHERE REP0 date_received >= ? AND date_received <= ? AND status = 1
                ORDER BY date_received DESC

get_all_dimensions_platforms_and_tests.sql:
SELECT `product` AS 'p',
                    `branch` AS 'b',
                    `branch_version` AS 'bv',
                    `operating_system_name` AS 'osn',
                    `operating_system_version` AS 'osv',
                    `test_name` AS 'tn',
                    `page_url` AS 'pu'
                FROM `test_data_all_dimensions`
                WHERE `product` = ? AND `branch` = ? AND `date_received` >= ? AND
                      `date_received` <= ? AND `status` = 1
                GROUP BY `product`, `branch`, `branch_version`, `operating_system_name`, `operating_system_version`, `test_name`, `page_url`
                ORDER BY date_received DESC

get_test_run_summary.sql:
SELECT tr.id AS 'test_run_id',
                       tr.revision,
                       tr.date_run,
                       b.product_id,
                       tr.test_id,
                       m.operating_system_id,
                       ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 2 ) AS avg,
                       ROUND( MIN(tv.value), 2 ) AS min,
                       ROUND( MAX(tv.value), 2 ) AS max,
                       ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'std'
                FROM test_run AS tr
                LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                LEFT JOIN test_value AS tv ON tr.id = tv.test_run_id
                LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                WHERE (tr.date_run >= REP0 AND tr.date_run <= REP1) REP2
                GROUP BY tr.id, tr.revision, b.product_id, tr.test_id, m.operating_system_id
                ORDER BY tr.date_run ASC

get_all_test_runs.sql:
SELECT tr.id AS 'test_run_id',
                       tr.revision,
                       tr.date_run,
                       b.product_id,
                       tr.test_id,
                       m.operating_system_id,
                       ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 2 ) AS avg,
                       ROUND( MIN(tv.value), 2 ) AS min,
                       ROUND( MAX(tv.value), 2 ) AS max,
                       ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'std'
                FROM test_run AS tr
                LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                LEFT JOIN test_value AS tv ON tr.id = tv.test_run_id
                LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                GROUP BY tr.id, tr.revision, b.product_id, tr.test_id, m.operating_system_id
                ORDER BY tr.date_run ASC

get_test_runs.sql:
SELECT SQL_CALC_FOUND_ROWS
                tr.revision, tr.date_run, tr.status,
                p.branch, p.product, p.version
            FROM test_run as tr
            LEFT JOIN build as b ON tr.build_id = b.id
            LEFT JOIN product as p ON b.product_id = p.id
            WHERE tr.date_run BETWEEN ? AND ?
            AND p.branch = ?
            ORDER BY tr.date_run DESC
            LIMIT 0, 80

get_test_run_counts.sql:
SELECT COUNT(tr.id) as count, p.branch
            FROM test_run AS tr
            LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
            LEFT JOIN product as p ON b.product_id = p.id
            WHERE tr.date_run BETWEEN ? AND ?
            GROUP BY p.branch

get_threshold_revisions.sql:
SELECT id, revision
               FROM test_run
               WHERE id IN (REP0)

get_test_run_ids.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT(tr.id) AS test_run_id
            FROM test_run AS tr
            LEFT JOIN build AS b ON b.id = tr.build_id
            LEFT JOIN product AS p ON p.id = b.product_id
            LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON m.id = tr.machine_id
            LEFT JOIN operating_system AS os ON os.id = m.operating_system_id
            LEFT JOIN test AS t ON t.id = tr.test_id
            WHERE p.branch = ? REP0

get_test_run_ids_from_pushlog_ids.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT(tpm.test_run_id)
               FROM test_page_metric AS tpm
               LEFT JOIN metric_value AS mv ON tpm.metric_value_id = mv.id
               WHERE mv.name = 'pushlog_id' AND tpm.value IN (REP0)

get_revision_products.sql:
SELECT p.product, p.branch, p.version
               FROM test_run AS tr
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               LEFT JOIN product AS p ON b.product_id = p.id
               WHERE tr.revision = ?
               GROUP BY p.product, p.branch, p.version

get_test_run_values.sql:
SELECT tv.test_run_id,
                        tv.page_id,
                        tv.run_id,
                        tr.revision,
                        tr.date_run,
                        b.product_id,
                        tr.test_id,
                        m.operating_system_id,
                        p.url,
                        v.name AS value_name,
                        tv.value
               FROM test_value AS tv
               LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
               LEFT JOIN value AS v ON tv.value_id = v.id
               LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
               LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               WHERE tv.test_run_id = ?
               ORDER BY p.url, tv.value ASC

get_test_run_value_summary.sql:
SELECT tv.test_run_id,
                        tv.page_id,
                        tv.run_id,
                        tr.revision,
                        tr.test_id,
                        tr.date_run,
                        b.product_id,
                        tr.test_id,
                        m.operating_system_id,
                        p.url,
                        ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 2 ) AS avg,
                        ROUND( MIN(tv.value), 2 ) AS min,
                        ROUND( MAX(tv.value), 2 ) AS max,
                        ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'std'
               FROM test_value AS tv
               LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
               LEFT JOIN value AS v ON tv.value_id = v.id
               LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
               LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               WHERE tv.test_run_id = ?
               GROUP BY tv.page_id
               ORDER BY p.url, tv.value ASC

get_b2g_value_summary_by_test_id.sql:
SELECT tv.test_run_id,
                      tv.page_id,
                      tr.revision,
                      tr.gecko_revision,
                      tr.build_revision,
                      tr.test_id,
                      tr.date_run,
                      b.product_id,
                      m.operating_system_id,
                      m.type,
                      p.url,
                      ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 0 ) AS avg,
                      ROUND( MIN(tv.value), 0 ) AS min,
                      ROUND( MAX(tv.value), 0 ) AS max,
                      ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 0 ) AS 'std',
                      GROUP_CONCAT(tv.value ORDER BY tv.value ASC SEPARATOR ',') AS 'replicates'
                FROM test_value AS tv
                LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
                LEFT JOIN value AS v ON tv.value_id = v.id
                LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
                LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                LEFT JOIN product AS pr ON b.product_id = pr.id
                WHERE tr.test_id IN (REP0) AND pr.branch = ? AND m.type = ? AND p.url = ? AND tr.date_run >= ? AND tr.date_run <= ? AND tr.status = 1
                GROUP BY tr.revision, tr.gecko_revision, tr.test_id, p.url
                ORDER BY tr.date_run, tr.id DESC

get_test_run_value_full_summary.sql:
SELECT tv.test_run_id,
                        tv.page_id,
                        tr.revision,
                        tr.test_id,
                        tr.date_run,
                        tr.test_id,
                        b.product_id,
                        m.operating_system_id,
                        m.name AS 'machine_name',
                        o.name AS 'operating_system_name',
                        o.version AS 'operating_system_version',
                        pr.product AS 'product_name',
                        pr.branch AS 'product_branch',
                        pr.version AS 'product_version',
                        b.processor,
                        b.build_type,
                        tr.date_run AS 'date',
                        t.name AS 'test_name',
                        p.url AS 'page_name',
                        ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'mean',
                        ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'std'
               FROM test_value AS tv
               LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               LEFT JOIN test AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
               LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
               LEFT JOIN product AS pr ON b.product_id = pr.id
               LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
               LEFT JOIN operating_system AS o ON m.operating_system_id = o.id
               WHERE tv.value_id = 1 AND tv.test_run_id IN (REP0)
               GROUP BY tr.id, tv.page_id

get_test_run_value_exclude_replicate_1.sql:
SELECT tv.test_run_id,
                        tv.page_id,
                        tr.revision,
                        tr.test_id,
                        tr.date_run,
                        tr.test_id,
                        b.product_id,
                        m.operating_system_id,
                        m.name AS 'machine_name',
                        o.name AS 'operating_system_name',
                        o.version AS 'operating_system_version',
                        pr.product AS 'product_name',
                        pr.branch AS 'product_branch',
                        pr.version AS 'product_version',
                        b.processor,
                        b.build_type,
                        tr.date_run AS 'date',
                        t.name AS 'test_name',
                        p.url AS 'page_name',
                        ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'mean',
                        ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'std'
               FROM test_value AS tv
               LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               LEFT JOIN test AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
               LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
               LEFT JOIN product AS pr ON b.product_id = pr.id
               LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
               LEFT JOIN operating_system AS o ON m.operating_system_id = o.id
               WHERE tv.value_id = 1 AND (tv.run_id != 1) AND tv.test_run_id IN (REP0)
               GROUP BY tr.id, tv.page_id

get_test_names_by_test_run_ids.sql:
SELECT tr.id, t.name
               FROM test_run AS tr
               LEFT JOIN test AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
               WHERE tr.id IN (REP0)

get_value_summary_by_test_id.sql:
SELECT tv.test_run_id,
                      tv.page_id,
                      tr.revision,
                      tr.gecko_revision,
                      tr.build_revision,
                      tr.test_id,
                      tr.date_run,
                      b.product_id,
                      m.operating_system_id,
                      m.type,
                      p.url,
                      ROUND( AVG(tv.value), 2 ) AS avg,
                      ROUND( MIN(tv.value), 2 ) AS min,
                      ROUND( MAX(tv.value), 2 ) AS max,
                      ROUND( STDDEV(tv.value), 2 ) AS 'std'
              FROM test_value AS tv
              LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
              LEFT JOIN value AS v ON tv.value_id = v.id
              LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
              LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
              LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
              LEFT JOIN product AS pr ON b.product_id = pr.id
              WHERE tr.test_id IN (REP0) AND pr.branch = ? AND m.type = ? AND p.url = ? AND tr.date_run >= ? AND tr.date_run <= ?
              GROUP BY tr.revision, tr.gecko_revision, tr.test_id, p.url
              ORDER BY tr.date_run, tr.id DESC

get_test_run_ids_from_revisions.sql:
SELECT tr.id
               FROM test_run AS tr
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               LEFT JOIN pages AS pg ON tr.test_id = pg.test_id
               LEFT JOIN product AS pr ON b.product_id = pr.id
               WHERE tr.revision = ? AND tr.gecko_revision = ? AND pr.branch = ? AND tr.test_id = ? AND pg.url = ?
               ORDER BY tr.id ASC

get_page_values.sql:
SELECT tv.id AS test_value_id,
                        tv.test_run_id,
                        tv.page_id,
                        tv.run_id,
                        tr.revision,
                        tr.date_run,
                        b.product_id,
                        tr.test_id,
                        m.operating_system_id,
                        p.url,
                        v.name AS value_name,
                        tv.value
               FROM test_value AS tv
               LEFT JOIN pages AS p ON tv.page_id = p.id
               LEFT JOIN value AS v ON tv.value_id = v.id
               LEFT JOIN test_run AS tr ON tv.test_run_id = tr.id
               LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
               LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
               WHERE tv.test_run_id = ? AND tv.page_id = ?
               ORDER BY p.url, tv.run_id ASC

get_product_test_os_map.sql:
SELECT b.product_id, tr.test_id, m.operating_system_id
                FROM test_run AS tr
                LEFT JOIN machine AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                LEFT JOIN build AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                WHERE b.product_id IN (
                  SELECT product_id
                  FROM product )
               GROUP BY b.product_id, tr.test_id, m.operating_system_id

get_build_data.sql:
SELECT `id`,
                      `product_id`,
                      `test_build_id`,
                      `processor`,
                      `revision`,
                      `build_type`,
                      `build_date`
               FROM build
               WHERE `product_id` = ? AND
                     `test_build_id` = ? AND
                     `processor` = ? AND
                     `build_type` = ?

get_test_collections.sql:
SELECT tc.id,
                       tc.name,
                       tc.description,
                       tcm.test_id,
                       tcm.product_id,
                       tcm.operating_system_id
                FROM test_collection AS tc
                LEFT JOIN test_collection_map AS tcm ON tc.id = tcm.test_collection_id
                LEFT JOIN test AS t ON tcm.test_id = t.id
                ORDER BY tc.name

get_metric_collection.sql:
SELECT m.id AS 'metric_id',
                          m.name AS 'metric_name',
                          mv.id AS 'metric_value_id',
                          mv.name AS 'metric_value_name'
                   FROM `metric` AS m
                   LEFT JOIN `metric_value` AS mv ON m.id = mv.metric_id

get_metric_threshold_test_run.sql:
SELECT mt.test_run_id, mt.revision
                   FROM metric_threshold AS mt
                   WHERE mt.product_id = ? AND
                         mt.operating_system_id = ? AND
                         mt.processor = ? AND
                         mt.build_type = ? AND
                         mt.metric_id = ? AND
                         mt.test_id = ? AND
                         mt.page_id = ?

get_test_evaluations_from_test_run_ids.sql:
SELECT b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          m.name AS 'machine_name',
                          o.name AS 'operating_system_name',
                          o.version AS 'operating_system_version',
                          p.product AS 'product_name',
                          p.branch AS 'product_branch',
                          p.version AS 'product_version',
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          b.test_build_id,
                          mv.metric_id,
                          tr.test_id,
                          tr.date_run AS 'date',
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          pg.url AS 'page_name',
                          tpm.page_id,
                          tpm.metric_value_id,
                          mv.name AS 'metric_value_name',
                          tpm.test_run_id,
                          tpm.threshold_test_run_id,
                          tr.revision,
                          tpm.value
                   FROM `test_page_metric` AS tpm
                   LEFT JOIN `pages` AS pg ON tpm.page_id = pg.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test_run` AS tr ON tpm.test_run_id = tr.id
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `product` AS p ON b.product_id = p.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `metric_value` AS mv ON tpm.metric_value_id = mv.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   LEFT JOIN `operating_system` AS o ON m.operating_system_id = o.id
                   WHERE mv.name IN ('test_evaluation',
                                     'mean',
                                     'stddev',
                                     'trend_mean',
                                     'trend_stddev',
                                     'p',
                                     'pushlog_id',
                                     'fdr',
                                     'push_date',
                                     'h0_rejected',
                                     'n_replicates')
                         AND tr.id IN (REP0)

get_computed_metrics_from_test_run_ids.sql:
SELECT b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          m.name AS 'machine_name',
                          o.name AS 'operating_system_name',
                          o.version AS 'operating_system_version',
                          p.product AS 'product_name',
                          p.branch AS 'product_branch',
                          p.version AS 'product_version',
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          b.test_build_id,
                          mv.metric_id,
                          tr.test_id,
                          tr.date_run AS 'date',
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          pg.url AS 'page_name',
                          tpm.page_id,
                          tpm.metric_value_id,
                          mv.name AS 'metric_value_name',
                          tpm.test_run_id,
                          tpm.threshold_test_run_id,
                          tr.revision,
                          tpm.value
                   FROM `test_page_metric` AS tpm
                   LEFT JOIN `pages` AS pg ON tpm.page_id = pg.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test_run` AS tr ON tpm.test_run_id = tr.id
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `product` AS p ON b.product_id = p.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `metric_value` AS mv ON tpm.metric_value_id = mv.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   LEFT JOIN `operating_system` AS o ON m.operating_system_id = o.id
                   WHERE tr.id IN (REP0)

get_computed_metrics.sql:
SELECT b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          mv.metric_id,
                          tr.test_id,
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          tpm.page_id,
                          tpm.metric_value_id,
                          mv.name AS 'metric_value_name',
                          tpm.test_run_id,
                          tpm.threshold_test_run_id,
                          tr.revision,
                          tpm.value
                   FROM `test_page_metric` AS tpm
                   LEFT JOIN `test_run` AS tr ON tpm.test_run_id = tr.id
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `metric_value` AS mv ON tpm.metric_value_id = mv.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   WHERE tr.revision = ?

get_metrics_data_from_ref_data.sql:
SELECT b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          mv.metric_id,
                          tr.test_id,
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          tpm.page_id,
                          tpm.metric_value_id,
                          mv.name AS 'metric_value_name',
                          tpm.test_run_id,
                          tpm.threshold_test_run_id,
                          tr.revision,
                          tpm.value
                   FROM `test_page_metric` AS tpm
                   LEFT JOIN `test_run` AS tr ON tpm.test_run_id = tr.id
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `metric_value` AS mv ON tpm.metric_value_id = mv.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   WHERE b.product_id = ? AND
                         m.operating_system_id = ? AND
                         b.processor = ? AND
                         b.build_type = ? AND
                         tr.test_id = ? AND
                         tr.id = ?

get_metrics_data_from_test_run_id_and_pa.sql:
SELECT b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          mv.metric_id,
                          tr.test_id,
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          tpm.page_id,
                          tpm.metric_value_id,
                          mv.name AS 'metric_value_name',
                          tpm.test_run_id,
                          tpm.threshold_test_run_id,
                          tr.revision,
                          tpm.value AS 'metric_value'
                   FROM `test_page_metric` AS tpm
                   LEFT JOIN `test_run` AS tr ON tpm.test_run_id = tr.id
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `metric_value` AS mv ON tpm.metric_value_id = mv.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   WHERE tpm.test_run_id = ? AND tpm.page_id = ?

get_test_values_by_revision.sql:
SELECT tr.id AS 'test_run_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          tr.test_id,
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          tr.revision,
                          p.branch,
                          tv.run_id,
                          tv.page_id,
                          tv.value
                   FROM `test_run` AS tr
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `product` AS p ON b.product_id = p.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test_value` AS tv ON tr.id = tv.test_run_id
                   WHERE tr.revision = ?

get_test_values_by_test_run_id_and_page_.sql:
SELECT tr.id AS 'test_run_id',
                          b.id AS 'build_id',
                          b.product_id,
                          m.operating_system_id,
                          b.processor,
                          b.build_type,
                          b.build_type,
                          tr.test_id,
                          t.name AS 'test_name',
                          tr.revision,
                          p.branch,
                          tv.run_id,
                          tv.page_id,
                          tv.value
                   FROM `test_run` AS tr
                   LEFT JOIN `build` AS b ON tr.build_id = b.id
                   LEFT JOIN `product` AS p ON b.product_id = p.id
                   LEFT JOIN `machine` AS m ON tr.machine_id = m.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test` AS t ON tr.test_id = t.id
                   LEFT JOIN `test_value` AS tv ON tr.id = tv.test_run_id
                   WHERE tr.id = ? AND tv.page_id = ?
